Though to be honest, I will probably just use this as my travel camera due to its ability to be underwater and in colder temps and get myself the wide lens 12.1 optical zoom panasonic as my everyday camera as I like a camera with the ability to have a great zoom.

Reviews.Title: Fantasic Camera (if you read the book)
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: I like most people like to pull a camera out and snap a picture. One can do that with this camera with moderate success...HOWEVER.....reading the cd that is included with the whole manual is mandatory reading to get the most out of the camera. I also echo other reviews that the lens position takes a little getting used to  and you WILL have a few shots early on with your finger in the picture. Also, I put a 32 gb card in the slot and the camera said it had +-5500 pics left.(as I expected). However only said it had 8 minutes of HD recording left. Called Panasonic and they had me reboot 3 times and then figured out that you can only take HD video in 8 minute bursts before putting in a chapter break. Not a big deal IF YOU READ THE MANUAL!!all in all.....good purchase and better than all the others.

Reviews.Title: worked well for a while
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Chet Brewer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 6 months ago for use around and in water. I used it on a couple of trips to the Caribbean as well as sea kayaking around my house. Picture quality was good and a lot of the presets worked well, especially water, motion, and sunset/night photography. I was pretty careful to clean camera and seals carefully after each trip to the beach, soaked in fresh water for 30 minutes then dried before removing battery or memory card. On my 8th or 9th snorkeling trip it looks like one of the seals let lose and the camera starting buzzing and shut down. I returned it to shore and soaked in fresh water before opening. It was full of water although the battery compartment orings still looked good.So on a sample size of one it looks like the ruggedness of this model is suspect. Wish it wasnt so because despite the clunky design it worked pretty well till it failed

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mr. i
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend which has a habit of not taking care well of her electronics but was in need of a digital camera. She uses the camera constantly in a farm enviroment as well in hiking trips. We are constantly on the move and therefore the camera seemed like a good investment. The image quality is amazing! Highly recommended for outdoor people.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2
Reviews.Author: Oscar
Reviews.Content: Pros: Easy to use. Rugged design, yet stylish. Excellent picture quality. Cons: Wished it came with its own custom designed Panasonic leather case. No lens cover.Have used it now for over 3 months.  Very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Decent for a waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: don y
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty good camera- good resolution pictures, not crazily bad noise despite pretty high pixel count, stayed waterproof as advertised for (so far) a single use in a pool- didn't push it too hard, only 5ft depth.  Obviously not a worst case gritty salty sandy beach scenario that people are complaining about leaks on, but Panasonic/Lumix had so so so many notes on foreign debris in gaskets and such so that it seems you would be doomed if you attempted to switch cards or batteries on the beach.  Short of a much bulkier external housing camera with bombproof gaskets, I think Lumix did about as good as they could, keeping the form factor small and fairly pretty- I like it better than the asymmetric flowy shapes used by some other manufacturers.  Downsides - dunno why the heck (other than to charge people more $$ to replace) Lumix opted for a proprietary funky USB cable- not mini or micro USB.  Lose it and you're spending more than for just a generic mini/micro USB replacement.  In the end, maybe moot, because battery life is only average/adequate, you'll run out of power before you fill up a 16gb SDHC card whether running video or pictures with some flash. Since you have to pop open the battery/card hatch to recharge the battery anyway, might as well pop out the SD card each time to download, rather than using the USB cable.

Reviews.Title: Excellent rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Walter C. Bronson "WaltBPE"
Reviews.Content: Just got back from first vacation with this camera.  If you like an active vacation and/or lifestyle and dont want to worry about carrying around an expensive fragile camera, but still want good pictures, this is the camera for you.  We spent time snorkling, hiking on a windy sandy beach, and zip lining.  The camera held up well throughout and took some very nice pictures of people, landscape, and underwater.  My only complaint is that it is a little slow between pictures, but I assume the burst mode will compensate for that if needed.  I had a rugged Olympus Stylus before this, which died snorkling on the last vacation.  My fault, had it in the water too long.  That was a great camera too, but did not take as good a picture as the Panasonic.For the size, zoom, ruggedness, and picture quality, thisis a great camera for active people.

Reviews.Title: Was great...
Reviews.Author: Christopher M. "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I was debating between this, the Pentax Optio W90, the Olympus Tough 8010, and the Sony Tx5. In the end, the Lumix won out. I made the right choice. It has a sort of polished beauty, with a shiny silver finish, ruggedized sides, and a great LCD screen. It responds and turns on quickly, takes some pretty darn good pictures, and even better video. With my slightly easygoing testing of its endurance, it's performed admirably, taking some 6 foot drops onto wood. I haven't gotten a great chance to test its waterproofness aside from the sink, but I will update on that. It has a good locking system that I'm confident will keep the water out, and although idiot-proof is just something waiting to be proved wrong, it seems like it. It has a good menu, with tabs for video, pictures, and the intelligent-auto function. While it's zoom is slightly slow, it works very quietly in video, barely able to be heard. It's built-in memory will let you take about 8 high-res photos, about 10-20 seconds of video. With an 8-gigabit card, you can take upwards of 1,300 high-res pictures, and about 180 minutes of video, 70 minutes per video. It's battery life is good for a point-and-shoot, with around 370 pictures off of a full charge. It's software is standard, although it can crash. The pictures I've taken with it seem good, even at full digital zoom if it's given a chance to focus. I will update later...UPDATE:Unfortunately, the quality didn't last. I took it on a trip up Mt. Marcy in New York and put it into a very shallow stream(at most 3-4 inches deep) to take a picture of the cool stream bed. I took it out and continued on. Later, when I took another picture, it seemed fuzzy. When I looked at the lens, there was condensation all along the inside of it. Nearer to the top on the hike, disaster struck again. The camera slipped out of my hand, from about a foot and a half above some slab rock. I picked it up, but didn't turn it back on. Assuming it was okay, I kept going. A little while later, I decided to take a picture of a valley view near the top. To my surprise, when I turned it on, half the screen was blacked out. The camera still takes great pictures, as only the screen was damaged, not the lens, but I am extremely disappointed at the low quality. I will be looking for a replacement camera.

Reviews.Title: Finally!
Reviews.Author: trucky105
Reviews.Content: We finally found a camera that keeps up with us!  From the beaches to the ski slopes this camera totally rocks!  Keep it clean and charged and it keeps up with you and takes awesome pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Mason
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  This camera much faster than other cameras in its class.  Used the camera in the water and in the rain on a week long cruise, no issues at all.  Overall, great camera and takes very good pictures for a waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera, needs a lense cover
Reviews.Author: gearhead
Reviews.Content: Great solid camera, it's not 100% intuitive but easy enough to use.  My only real complaint and a a pretty big one is the lack of cover for the lens.  Its marketed as water proof and shock proof, for me that means mtn biking, snowmobiling but mainly water sports.  When paddle boarding or kite surfing it needs to be in a pocket, however there is no lens cover so I am worried about it scratching the lens.  It's too big to leave in a case and you wouldn't want the case to get wet.  Great camera, bad design without a lens that automatically closes like almost every other camera on the market.

Reviews.Title: Disapointed by the video and especially the sound quality
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: My main use for this camera is to bring it in places where I would not dare bringing more fragile and expensive equipment. This is overall a decent rugged P&S; camera for pictures, although I still miss the better UI of my previous Canon. It is very dust proof, pretty solid and can be cleaned up easily. But I am totally disappointed by the video recording side. The image stabilization that does a good job for the pictures is failing totally on the videos. The continuous auto-focusing is actually continuously defocusing the video in low light or when zooming in and out (fortunately this can be turned off). More annoying is the sound quality. It's very bad compared to previous similar cameras I had. The camera has a very average sound quality in normal levels to start with (mono). But it cannot handle loud scenes properly. If you are planning to use this camera at events with high volumes, like concerts, with plenty of bass, you'll need to move a literally a few miles aways from the speakers. Otherwise the bass will be turn in clipping noise and the auto-leveling will attenuate brutally most of the rest of spectrum, until the beats stop for a few seconds. What a frustration! My previous P&S; (Canon SD870) did not have any of those problems and even if the video was not 720p, the result was a lot better. I was expecting something better for the price.

Reviews.Title: Significant issues
Reviews.Author: MoeAlfa "emwmd"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality at higher optical zooms is simpy awful and the color balance is consistently too bluish.  However it is tough as nails and battery life is superb.  Have used now for several seasons of sailing, including some offshore races, where I just left it out in the cockpit for all to use, and have taken it snorkeling often.  No idea how it compares to other junky little waterproofs.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: alex agranovich
Reviews.Content: Reliable, user friendly. Resistant to water as suggested. Took it all over the world and it's never failed. Highly recomended

Reviews.Title: Meh.....
Reviews.Author: Derek Stone
Reviews.Content: No need for proprietary wiring.  Use a USB/Micro USB and call it a day, Panasonic.  For this reason, I will only look at electronics with 'easy to use/find' connection wiring.I refuse to buy another connecting wire, and therefore refuse to buy Panasonic again.  Folks, look for cameras that use USB's, for your own sanity.Camera works fine, but they got greedy with the wires.......so tedious.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: bill bronson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Although I would love a DSLR, this is perfect for me, because I am prone to abusing cameras and like to have something that can handle some shock and some wear and tear.  I've had it 10 feet underwater, 15,000 feet up on a mountain (at -25F), in blowing dust and dirt, its been dropped on rocks in rivers and onto concrete from 5 feet, out of my truck and my pocket many times, and still takes awesome pictures.  I used it to take my wedding photos and they turned out great, with very good definition across the full field and great color.  For a point and shoot, this this is the best!!!

Reviews.Title: Very good point and shoot..
Reviews.Author: J. Ortiz
Reviews.Content: Very good camera.  Works extremely well underwater.  Panasonic has extremely good warranty.  Been using it for years, have taken hundreds of pictures.  Have been used at the local pool, water park, beach.  Work flawlessly...Highly recommend for anyone looking for a waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.  Drop it, submerge it.
Reviews.Author: WIStoney
Reviews.Content: There are only two things I don't like...no lens cover (gets smudges and pocket lint) and no viewfinder with option to turn off the back screen, which is bright at night.  Other than that, this camera has been to combat in Iraq, travelled to Europe, swam in two oceans, canoe camping, mountain hiking.  It's tough and takes great pics.  With a 32 GB card, it will take a lot of pics!  I got a float strap for canoe trips and an extra battery.

Reviews.Title: Bought in June 2010, used under water for 10+ times, still good!
Reviews.Author: Yau Fong Chan "Kylab"
Reviews.Content: The image quality is ok if there is enough light. The iphone will produce better image than this camera when use indoor. However, the video quality is excellence by today's standard. The build quality is good as well. very tough.

Reviews.Title: Great and Indestructible
Reviews.Author: B. Dawson
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing.  It takes great photo and videos!  It's also indestructible.  Waterproof, dustproof, freezeproof, shockproof!  We use it snowboarding and it has always worked like a charm (even when my Sony stopped working at -36!).  Definitely worth the price of admission.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for travels and outdoors!
Reviews.Author: C. Mao
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a present for my then boyfriend, now husband.This camera has now been to the beaches and coast off of Belize, to snowboarding trips in Colorado, to the water park in Texas, and on many hikes.It withstands all that is stated in the product description.Pros: Ease of use, different features for different settings (underwater, portrait, etc), durability and ruggedness, and quality of photos, small enough to fit in your pocket without fear of breaking it, great design.Cons: Pricey (but well worth it).I also own a Nikon D90, and have had several other cheaper and smaller cameras. Various things happened to those various cameras such as: salt water damage from living by the beach, breaking from dropping the camera. One of the toughest things with a larger camera is the difficulty of carrying it.I have been able to take this camera everywhere without the anxiety of "hurting" it and having to buy a new one.The Megapixels on this camera is also the same as my DSLR so the pictures come out great. I would highly recommend this camera for someone who is active and plans on using this camera in any environment. I would rather have this one versatile camera then have all the other cameras I've ever bought.

Reviews.Title: NOT FOR UNDERWATER USE
Reviews.Author: S. Fry
Reviews.Content: had this camera for over a year, fine for "rain use" but went snorkeling with it, and the seals failed & leaked on the second swim!  Of course it's out of warranty and Panasonic want $180 to fix it.  NO THANKS!  I'll get a "real" underwater camera next trip.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 2 years. I've used it underwater many times but typically have used it as a point and shoot camera. I've always loved it, but yesterday, I was shocked and amazed!! I was tubing in a river that had some rapids. I had my camera with me. T the very end of the river, I was flipped from my tube and my camera was gone!!  I was heartbroken....I had tons of pics that I had not transferred!!  Six hours later, my cousin and I remember that the river becomes much shallower after the dam closes. So we head down in an attempt to figure out exactly where I lost the camera. I was excited to look, but at that point was thinking that if by some miracle we found the camera, it surely wouldn't work after 6 hours in the water. After wading through the river for about a mile, we found the spot where the camera was lost. And 6 inches away, is my camera wedged between some rocks!!!  We grab it and the first thing I attempt to do is turn it on....and it works!!!! I am so shocked that after 6 hours in a rocky river, in a spot where the current was literally knocking us over, my camera survived and is as good as new!!! I HIGHLY recommend this camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Everyday-use sort of camera
Reviews.Author: J. Kent
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an everyday-use sort of camera. I've been using it for a while and it isn't perfect, but it does an okay job for most things.The main failing of this camera has to be its poor low-light performance. I'm by no means a photographic expert, but the small lens and sensor combined are the likely culprits. This problem is exacerbated somewhat by the relatively small built in flash.The other major quality gripe I have is the resolution. The optics of this camera are not even close to resolving 14 MP. Zoom in on any pic from this camera, and you will see blur long before you see pixels. Think of this camera as closer to 8MP maybe, or less even.Beyond the quality issues the functionality of this camera is great. The 5x optical zoom is plenty for a pocket camera like this, and zooming during video is nice.The camera boots up in about a second, and can take pretty quick shots; this makes it great catching unexpected pictures. Plus, there is no telescoping lens or lens cap to wait far. It is literally 3 seconds between having the camera in your pocket and taking a picture.Being water proof and rugged is a major plus. I've taken lots of underwater shots with it; there is less light available underwater, which can be an issue, but otherwise it works great.This camera does a good job of being there when you need it, and getting the shot you want in time. I recommend it on these attributes; if that isn't what you need there are cheaper cameras with better quality.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed. Bad waterproof camera.
Reviews.Author: mgalleri
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a vacation trip to the Caribbean sea at Colombia. I'll ready had a good camera but I was looking for a waterproof good one. When I received it, I tried it in a swimming pool and it worked ok. And since the pictures outside the water were also good quality, I just travelled with my brand new waterproof Panasonic camera. But I was very disappointed after the first time I introduced into the water. I just could take 2 pictures before the camera hung because it had water inside. And all the lock buttons were in the right place. Now, it is not working anymore.

Reviews.Title: Shots I never could have taken
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: I bought this on Amazon, but they delivered it too late, so I actually ended up buying it in a physical shop and returning the Amazon one. Top marks to Amazon for their return policy!That over with. The camera is waterproof at least to a depth of about 3ft - I took some underwater shots just for fun. I bought this camera to allow me to take a camera into the water with me rather than snorkelling / or underwater shots. I took it into the sea, into a waterfall, a lake, and got holiday snaps I would never have had with a standard digital camera.Main PointsDoes what it says on the tin - it is waterproof.Picture Quality - I think it is good. Not as good as a comparably priced non-waterproof camera, but that is not the point!It floats with an Olympus STRAP FLOAT attached. This was a concern of mine when purchasing it. A float strap is a must if you plan on taking it into the sea / river / lake.Burst mode - fast somewhere between 3 - 4 per second is my estimation. V good for taking action shots - surfing etc.No viewfinder - only a screen. (I think this is good, because it allows you to see more easily if there is a droplet of water on the lens)Optical zoom - better than I expected. (It is self contained inside the camera)Ease of use: I found it simple to use. No complaints.Why not 5 stars?It should be possible for the camera itself to detect when there is water on the lens clouding the image. Maybe I'm being picky, and I don;t know if any camera has that built in, but software should be able to detect it pretty easily and put a warning signal on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera - worth the money
Reviews.Author: Capt Dan
Reviews.Content: I did a good bit of research before buying this camera.  I started searching after using one someone else had.  I figured I could find something as good but cheaper.  That didn't happen.Some things to know!!  I saw this camera cheaper from a few NYC dealers.  They actually told me the camera was shipped with a non-recharable disposable battery!  They wanted $80 for the real battery.  Not a bargin.I had a camera mask and it leaked pretty fast.  This camera has gone down about 20ft so far and it was fine.  I've taken a lot of pictures and had it in saltwater maybe half a dozen times so far and it has been a champ.The only problem I've encountered is that you can't see the display under water unless you have a mask on.  So I've missed some pics.  The camera mask idea is a good one but they can only go to 10 ft and mine leaked at 10 the second time I used it.I got this from Amazon and the customer service was amazingly great!  Very helpful (I needed to change the shipping address the next day as I got a ticket for the sunny Carib where I'm using this camera.)

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera and it is great! I am not an expert on pictures or video quality but for my needs this camera is great.Style - superb, looks great and feels comfortable to hold the button layout is awesome and easy to use setup(there is also an auto setting so you do not have to configure anything the camera does it for you).ruggedness - have not really dropped it but did test it and it withstood a drop of about 4' or so. I just wouldn't advise slamming it on the ground.waterproof - GREAT! I was nervous at first because it said in the instructions nothing could be on the orange seals for the compartments or water would get in. I used the supplied brush and cleaned it good. then took it in my pool. No leaks at all. I went all the way to the bottom which is 6' and worked perfectly.overall the quality is great and pictures were fantastic in and out of water. The videos for this are also not bad however the mic on the camera sometimes might get covered by a finger which muffles the voice. However I would recommend this camera to anyone and I think is one of the best waterproof cameras!

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected for the price...
Reviews.Author: Lisa A. Roper
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera now for over six months and we are not very happy with it.It's not very easy for my non-techy husband to use.  When taking pictures indoors or in low light... the automatic photos all come out very grainy and most are blurry as well.  The pictures are overwhelmingly have a red or yellow overtone.  We missed some great pics at our friends wedding and on our honeymoon.  Outdoor bright light pictures are fine, nothing to brag about, but not bad either.The saving grace on this was the video option and the underwater capability... The HD video quality is AMAZING (although, you'll want to change the default format or you won't be able to share it with other people).  We used it for our honeymoon in Mexico and the in the water pics/video's came out pretty good... shots we otherwise would not have had.Overall we are NOT happy with the camera, especially at the price we paid.  My $89 7 meg Sony Cybershot takes MUCH better pictures.  I wish I had either purchased the bulkier Sony or the lower priced Olympus.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: so far, love this thing!  my new every day point and shoot.  the extra stabelizer is a little overrated, but overall, you can't go wrong with this camera.  video isn't so good in dark conditions, but there are a lot of functions that can be played with that i haven't gotten to.  i totally recommend this camera based on picture quality, style, and waterproofness...

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted to make sure I had a high quality camera that I could take anywhere  for pics and recording video.  I've dropped this camera about 5 times already, not unusual for me though; but not having to replace it is awesome! I use the iA mode a lot, it works very well and for a point and shoot camera this it the best : D  .  I've put some pics up of a few pics that I've taken, I really enjoy taking pictures whenever I can now!  I have an aquarium so I took some pics "underwater" of my axolotls to check out the quality; very nice pics as well!  Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: Almost does it all !!
Reviews.Author: cmlegend
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that would last as long as my Canon SD600 which in fact lasted 5 years. But why not get an underwater camera which I can enjoy filming my kids in the pool or doign some video on my next sun destination trips...I have done over 4 hours of camera comparaison from different high ranked camera review sites and the 2 best were Canon D10 and Lumix TS2.Canon is cheaper but is bulky and looks like a kids toy. So Lumix was the best choice since it can easily be put away in your pocket without looking like you have a piece of salami in your shorts !I bought the silver but I'm always regretting not getting the blue one but my wife keeps telling me that Silver looks more professional and not too flashy...Alright, now the review... This camera does it all except for 2 things... Its perfect underwater, the HD movies are easy to import into your favorite movie editing software. The pics looks amazing and it really is a ncie camera to look at. The silicone jacket can protect the camera from scratches but unless you do skateboard with it, its really not useful. It makes the camera difficult to put in your pocket... The IAF mode (intelligent pics) is the best since you don;t have to worry about anything... simply point and shoot and the pic will look very good....The cons: So far I only saw 2 things they should of done... the custom timer doesn't let you take more than 1 pics at a time... my old Canon could let you customize it between 1 and 10 pics in one timer.The other thing is the lense... its always open so you can scratch it. Panasonic says that the lenses is anti-scratch but between you and I..it will eventually scratch. Unlike the Olympus which has the little closing trap... but the Olympus sucks in rating...So far I am very impressed... and totally recommend buying it. Even if you don't live near the ocean... since you can use this camera everywhere and not worry about anything. Beach, snow, outdoors, on a boat or anywhere else...One last thing... if you take it on a boat or go in the ocean, get the floating  wrist strap from Olympus.. it could help if you ever drop it in the water.Cheers !

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: jbolf6
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. I use it metal detecting and it performs flawless. Need a camera like this if you are going to use it out doors contantly

Reviews.Title: Bad pictures
Reviews.Author: Dr Pots
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for it's toughness and waterproof ability and for being a supposedly high spec point and shoot.Largely disappointed with this camera. Comparing to a canon of a similar price but not water proof, the pictures are really, really bad. Colors are muted and grainy, with focus more by luck than judgment. Don't attempt to use the auto settings as you will end up with worthless grainy images. The camera has extremely slow focusing and very bad light metering. The lens is in a ridiculous place where you always put your finger when you hold the camera. The camera randomly takes lower resolution images if it thinks the conditions are not right.I never been more disappointed with a cost to quality ratio. It is as bad as an old disposable 35 mm film camera.On the positive, if you can get the camera to focus on the subject you want, the video can be really good, and underwater it takes OK pictures, but no where near as good as my 4 year old much lower spec canon SD-1000 in a waterproof case.If I could return this I would.

Reviews.Title: Poor Pictures with Flash
Reviews.Author: JeffS
Reviews.Content: Any pictures with a flash had an orange hue, regardless of where I took them.  Outside pictures were very good, and the video was excellent quality.  Too many rules to follow to ensure water proof and dust proof.  They should make it easier, and definitely fix flash shots. I had a Pentax Optio before - much better shots than this one but it finally broke.  I returned the Panasonic - can't live with the poor flash quality.

Reviews.Title: 3.5 Star rating.
Reviews.Author: Crabs Rugby
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I bought this for our honeymoon in the virgin islands. We wanted a SLR but they are too big to travel with and are super expensive with extra lenses, and waterproof casings... That being said we stayed at a condo on the beach and for several days had the patio doors open (ie warm in room) and then we decided to use the AC about 4 days in the inside of the camera lense fogged up! Yes that was probably our fault but keep in mind with a sealed waterproof camera you can end up condensing moisture inside the camera when going from warm to cold. We opened the room back up to the outside air and it fixed itself over night...Other than that the underwater seals did great! No water leakage. However the photos aren't the best.. I had an old 7MP sony with a Zeiss lense and it took much better land scape and night photos. There is some noise in the backgound of the photos out of the water. In the water I found myself needing to take the same picture 2-4 times to get a good one to keep. Photoshop does help correct some of color and light issues you get under water. the other problem is keeping the camera still while snorkeling... The image stabilization works ok but the camera definatly works better if you are under water and not moving. I'm sure the pictures would get better if I knew how to use all the menus and functions that it has built in... But let's be honest with ourselves here... How many of us are going to learn what each sub-menu item does and remember how to use it? I am a point a click user for the most part and have written this review as such.The Ruggedness is good as i have dropped it several times (another good reason to buy if you are hard on electronics). Battery life is ok... We turn it off and on a lot and that seems to wear the battery down quickly and when using it on a regular basis during the day... Well you'll need to recharge every night to be safe for the next day.I was hoping to "have it all" with this camera. Great pic quality, good video, and great under water, and superior ruggedness. We ended up with an ok pic quality, great ruggedness, and haven't tested the video yet. I have found the 14mp will allow you to crop down a shot significantly and still be decent quality to print and put on the wall. All in all it's a good little camera and we would probably buy again for use on the beach, in water, and small enough to travel with. We'll probably still get an SLR in the future for better pic quality when we want it. I posted 4 pics of from the night palm tree shot to the scenic view of a bay.

Reviews.Title: High level of noise in low-light situations
Reviews.Author: chins01
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with the intent to use it as an all purpose camera. I was looking for a camera that could work just as well on a kayaking or hiking trip as at a wedding. While this camera may be great for outdoor shots taken in bright light, the picture quality is awful for indoor pictures taken in semi-low light situations. The pictures are very noisy. I hesitated to give this camera two stars because I think the rating really depends on your intended use. If you'll be using it mainly outside in rugged situations I'd probably give it 4 stars. If you intend to use it as an all purpose camera it's worth about 1 star. I haven't tested the underwater features yet because I unfortunately plan to return the camera.

Reviews.Title: Bought one for my brother, and he loves it.
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: My brother is a trained photographer, and as far as waterproof, ruggedized cameras go this one is great.  He's very happy with the image quality day and night, plus it hasn't had an issue in water.  It's a little pricey, but a great camera nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: It works underwater
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Gillaspie
Reviews.Content: It doesn't take the best pictures I've ever seen, but the ability to take it into the pool or give it to someone who is likely to drop it without worrying about it makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: Lack of lens cover fatal flaw
Reviews.Author: Jordan Kushner
Reviews.Content: Took one night of pictures.  Most pictures were ruined by dust particles on the lens.  If you carry your camera in a pocket, rather than in a case, this isn't the camera for you.Amazon's return policy/procedure is painless and fast.  Much more convenient than waiting in line at Best Buy.  Kudos to Amazon for that.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mikew
Reviews.Content: Puchased this camera on a recommendation from a friend for a family trip to the Bahamas. Wanted something to use while snorkling and at the water parks. Worked great, easy to use and helped capture a lot of great moments. No problem in the water and veery clear pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: In the short time I've had it it's great.
Reviews.Author: bisjack
Reviews.Content: I received this camera yesterday and since it's winter in Indiana I've not had a chance to be in the water with it, yet.  The picture quality is just as good if not better than the other Panasonic point and shoots that I own.  Even though I was warned that the waterproof cameras don't shoot as well as the others.  Not true with this one.The styling is modern and attractive.  The menu is easily negotiated.  The one irritant is the instructions about waterproofing it's operation that comes on everytime I turn it on.  I've been shooting outdoors and indoors with it with and without flash.  Great detail and the red-eye eliminator really works.  I give this a 4 star rating at this time only because I haven't had the opportunity to take it in the water.  For a dry alnd point and shoot it's a 5 star.  After I get some wet experience I may want to modify this rating.

Reviews.Title: Not so perfect... Camera for Outdoors Lovers.. updated review due to leakage
Reviews.Author: Amer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera yesterday from BH photo for [...] bucks. I use my cellphone camera for regular day to day photos. I am minimalist & prefer to carry as little as possible. So I will use this camera only for adventures.This is big but not too big camera. It will fit in your jeans but tightly. A lot of people were complaining on online forums/reviews that zoom & shutter buttons are too close, but I think it's not really any problem for most people. Perhaps people with really thick fingers will have some issues.Controls are very natural & easy to figure out without reading the manual.The supplied sleeve is perfect. I had another waterproof camera before this one. I knew that not to open battery cover underwater but one of my friend opened it underwater & ruined the camera. I will keep this camera in sleeve to prevent accidentally opening battery cover under water.Photo quality is pretty good. I haven't done enough tests but really this camera is for capturing great adventure shots and NOT for producing billboard sized advertisements. Indoor photos came out perfect with & without flash. I will take some outdoors photos this weekend. (weekend starts in 2 hours)Only complaint I have is that I wish this camera was slimmer & slightly more stylish. Then I could use it as everyday camera as well. And then it would be 5 stars camera.--------------------------Update 6/20/2011After a year it seems, seals are not as tight as last year. I was at pool this weekend when my camera decided to stop working. Battery was fully charged. Took it home, saw some moisture leaking in HDMI compartment. I let it dry overnight and it started to work again. but not sure if I will be using it underwater anymore now.I learned that you suppose to apply silicon gel to water seals every time you take it under water???So I took one star off.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend
Reviews.Author: ASchrad3
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures / videos. I am very impressed and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: great above and under water photos
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann E.
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera before a trip to Big Island, Hawaii hoping to have one camera to take land and under water photos.  We are pleasantly satisfied.  The photos we took on land were very clear and sharp....and even more pleased by the photos we took underwater while snorkeling.  The photos are crisp and clear both above and below water.  We love having just one camera for both!

Reviews.Title: Best camera you could ever buy
Reviews.Author: Tori
Reviews.Content: This is honestly the best camera that you could ever buy.  The picture and video quality are both excellent. Works great in the pool and in the water at the beach too. What impressed me most about this camera is that i actually dropped it in the mud and then ran it over with an ATV when i was on vacation and it still works perfectly.  This camera is a great value for the price.  Buy this camera and you will not be disapointed!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Kayaking Camera
Reviews.Author: Reeeeeeeder
Reviews.Content: used this in windy and very wet conditions kayaking, so far so good.camera could be slimmer, and the controls are pretty lame.. but I just hit 'record' and it works fairly good.just happy to have camera I can use anywhere, and video is very good once you set it to Quicktime recording

Reviews.Title: Get One!  This is a great camera.
Reviews.Author: RML
Reviews.Content: I shoot pro Nikon SLR's and really like the Lumix point and shoots.  This one is great.  The video has both formats and the usual high quality well saturated pics from the camera.  Even though it is a bit heavier than the non waterproof models, I like the ease of the controls.  The are bigger and easier to use.  Underwater the images are fantastic.  Great camera and you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Great photos and video
Reviews.Author: John Antista
Reviews.Content: Very easy to operate. HD video was impressive - the zoom and management of light levels in particular - and the format played well on my PC without the need to download any additional drivers, etc (Windows7 machine).  Flash is not overly bright and shoots well in low light with relatively little graininess.  It also seems better built / engineered than the competing Olympus models, also offering better video than the equivalent models.

Reviews.Title: Great service from Amazon but really bad camara for panasonic
Reviews.Author: Carmen Carrero
Reviews.Content: Like it is a water proof camara in one year I only usted a couplu of times, the principal lens always got misty and after a year of bought, one of the locks of one of the camara doors, ( a little piece of plastic that locks the camara) just broke by itself, I sent the camara to panasonic in texas and they ask me to pay a fee of 180,00 for the repair when the camara costs now 200 american dollars, my revew DONT BUY THIS CAMARA!!! is a bad one and the service of panasonic does not work!

Reviews.Title: rattles
Reviews.Author: Olive
Reviews.Content: just received my camera yesterday and if i shake it something rattles inside. is this normal or should i contact amazon for a replacement? i havent even taken it outside yet, just took some test shots inside the house and it seems to be working. also, have not tested in underwater.

Reviews.Title: Good water resistance, but afraid to use underwater
Reviews.Author: Tom "Tom"
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera only a couple of weeks.  It is easy to operate and the pictures come out fine.  It seems reasonably rugged, but based on all the reports of issues with using it underwater, I view it as water resistant, not waterproof.  Since I intend it to be used during hikes and bike tours, it seems like a good fit.  Be aware that it is significantly more bulky and heavier than a similar camera which is not water resistant.

Reviews.Title: Great until
Reviews.Author: T. Cook "UsedCarSalesman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera while deployed to Africa for its so called ruggedness and reviews. I had it for a bout 2 weeks and went to lake Ghoubet for a little snorkeling. I checked the camera seals were clean, locked the doors on the camera was in the water for about two trips of 15 min at a depth of less then 3 feet. By the time I got back from the trip (about a 2 hour drive). The camera quit letting me take pictures, and now says "turn off and turn on the camera" after being on for a few min. I did take a lot of good pictures, prior to the issue, but you can get a lot of good pictures from a normal camera that isn't so called "waterproof" for half the price.

Reviews.Title: This camera is the Bomb!!!
Reviews.Author: Batman09 "batman09"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moAGDA6D1EBJOU', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moAGDA6D1EBJOUloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } } } Length:: 0:00 MinsI took this camera to Hawaii.I had a great time!!!Did tons of snorkeling with it and took lots of pictures!!It takes incredible underwater pictures and video!!!Buy this camera....dont even look at the canon or the exlim....I looked at all of them for a couple of months....Im really glad I chose this camera!!!At 14.1mp takes great everyday pictures and video too!!!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Rena P. Crispin
Reviews.Content: don't get this camera unless you're prepared to deal with the hassles of transferring your photos from the camera to your computer. The manual is not helpful. I discovered that if I want to use the software that comes with the camera to transfer images, I have to remove all other photo editing software from my computer--photoshop, irfanview, etc. and even then it doesn't work. If you don't care about transferring images to your computer, but care about picture quality, don't get this camera. The quality of the images is poor. If you don't care about those two features but want something that claims to be rugged, give it a try. I never got to that point because I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: The Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: John Mohr
Reviews.Content: The camera is a bit difficult to get used to.  The picture button is not as responsive as other small cameras I have owned and the flash is also slow in responding.  As a result we have missed pictures we might otherwise have enjoyed.As a result I will probably only use this camera during outdoor activities, e.g. fishing, golf, etc.I will probably look for a different camera for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Good :)
Reviews.Author: Corygirl "Corygirl :)"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, but the only thing that I don't like, is that it doesn't have lens cover, good pictures, nice HD video

Reviews.Title: Does not take kayaking video that's worth watching!
Reviews.Author: R. KO
Reviews.Content: It is a great sport camer for picure taking.  However, fine print in user manual says image stablization does not work for moving sujects --- translation: you have to SIT/STAND STILL and DO NOT PAN for the image stablization to work when you take video!  Otherwise the video footage shakes so much it is not worth watching!  I bought this mainly for taking video on kayaking outtings, guess what, none of the video footage taken with any kind of boat movement except in extreme flat water has so much hand induced (not boat induced) shaking and it makes the viewer sea sick.  It is such a shame that a device made for water sport can not handle day to day real water sport environment... I sincerely hope a firmeare upgrade fixes this problem!Updated 6/1/10:The problem is that small hand shakes are not being removed when the camera is moving along with the boat. I have no problem having the video panning with the boat movement, which gives the viewer the real life feeling of being on a boat. It is the handshakes that are not being removed because the image stablization fails to work when the camera is moving with the boat. My Sony point and shoot camera does not have this problem, even though the video shows the rocking effect from the boat, it is not shaking due to hand shakes.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment
Reviews.Author: L. Qi
Reviews.Content: It's probably harsh for me to give it a 1 star. Because it's not worse than any other P/S camera currently on the market. But I just hate the way Panasonic(and other manufacturers as well) boost the pixel count to entice consumer while pay no attention to those real weakness of most P/S: dynamic range, noise etc.The picture taken with this camera is FULL OF NOISE. It's virtually useless on 14M pixel. Even under direct sunlight, ASA 50, noise is still everywhere. My Canon EOS-5D does a better job at ASA 1600.I had an 5 years old TZ2 camera does a better job than this brand new shining one. Why? Because TZ2 has much less pixel count on the same size of CCD!Manufacturers should stop pumping up pixels and deliver something real. It is absolutely nonsense to squeeze 14MB pixel into such a tiny chip. Even for APS size chips, 15~18M is the maximum

Reviews.Title: very bad camera
Reviews.Author: Stefano Desideri
Reviews.Content: I was waiting long time for this camera, on the paper i t was very good, but they have a lot of defect in conception.The quality of the picture is quite good in daylight but in the night the overall quality of the picture is very bad: you will just have a lot of noise. It is no protection on the lens: it very easy to put the fingers on it, then the quality of the picture will even worst.The next point is the zoom command: practically impossible to use!! The shoothing commad also is not well designed because is not where you are expecting.I take in the hand the "Olympus miu" and it seams much better from the design point of view: there is protection for the lens, zoom is ergonomically well made. If you really need underwater camera please buy Canon or Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Bad seller
Reviews.Author: Ggjax
Reviews.Content: I gave 1 star to make sure everybody reads it. Dont buy from portable guy! Sent me an open item in box looks like trash. The camera itself could be 5 star but i had to reorder it from ebay! Bad amazon experience wont use them again.

Reviews.Title: No Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: H. Silver
Reviews.Content: I cannot comment on the optics of this camera. I never took a picture with it. I took it out of the box, saw there was no viewfinder, put the camera back in the box, and returned it to Amazon. [Side note: Amazon's return procedures went very smoothly.] I guess it is just a personal thing with me, but I loathe trying to take a photo with the camera at arms length and the sun's glare bouncing off the LCD screen. I suppose it was my fault for not noticing that this camera didn't have a viewfinder before I ordered it, but I must have naively assumed that only cheap, crappy cameras lacked a viewfinder. My bad.

ProductInfo.Features:
The DMC-TS2 is dropproof from a height up to 6.6ft in accordance with the MIL-STD 810F Method 516.5-Shock test standard.
With freezeproof to -10 degrees C/14 degrees F, the DMC-TS2 supports shooting while skiing, snowboarding or skating.
The DMC-TS2 features an LED light that records beautiful motion images even in dusky underwater environments or at a nighttime camp.
Photo & Movie modes
Optical Zoom 4.6x / Digital Zoom 1 4x
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2 14.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
